citeinfo.title: Subsurface Temperature, Moisture, Thermal Conductivity and Heat Flux, Barrow, Area A, B, C, D

descript.abstract: Subsurface temperature data are being collected along a transect from the center of the polygon through the trough (and to the center of the adjacent polygon for Area D). Each transect has five 1.5m vertical array thermistor probes with 16 thermistors each. This dataset also includes soil pits that have been instrumented for temperature, water content, thermal conductivity, and heat flux at the permafrost table. Area C has a shallow borehole of 2.5 meters depth is instrumented in the center of the polygon. doi:10.5440/1126515, http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1126515
descript.purpose: These data are being collected to better understand the thermal dynamics of the active layer and permafrost. The data could also be used as supporting measurements for other research and modeling activities.

procstep.procdesc: Instruments are measured every 10 minutes and hourly averages are computed and stored on the datalogger. The exception to this is the Thermal Conductivity probes which are measured daily and the raw data is stored for offline processing.

Data are collected hourly using Loggernet and the data are then automatically imported into Vista Data Vision for immediate viewing via the internet (http://lapland.gi.alaska.edu/vdv/index.html). At this point the data have not been inspected or QCed so they should be considered provisional.
The thermal conductivity data are processed automatically using a Matlab script and then added to the Vista Data Vision database.
As needed the data in the Vista Data Vision database are visually inspected and QCed. Data can then be downloaded from the Vista Data Vision interface using the NGEE login.
Annually or more frequently if needed, output files are generated from the database.

ome.datause: The data are supplied in a ascii csv file with header. It should be noted that the time is in UTC and not local time. Units of the variables are given in the header of the file. Empty cells indicate a gap in data, bad data that has been removed, or data that doesn't exist. No gap filling has been done.
